amendment.description: To ensure that United States diplomats and officials of the U.S. Section of the International Boundary and Water Commission are able to advance efforts seeking compliance by the United Mexican States with the 1944 Treaty on Utilization of Waters of the Colorado and Tijuana Rivers and of the Rio Grande.

vote.text: Amendment SA 1249, under the order of 10/24/23, having not achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 282.

action.text: Amendment SA 1249 proposed by Senator Cruz to Amendment SA 1092. (consideration: CR S5281-5282) To ensure that United States diplomats and officials of the U.S. Section of the International Boundary and Water Commission are able to advance efforts seeking compliance by the United Mexican States with the 1944 Treaty on Utilization of Waters of the Colorado and Tijuana Rivers and of the Rio Grande.

Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 1249, under the order of 10/24/23, having not achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 282.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 1249, under the order of 10/24/23, having not achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 282.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1249 proposed by Senator Cruz to Amendment SA 1092.
